title: Cloud-Based Higher Education Language Instructional Design Microlearning Course: Integrated Text·Voice·Video Language Learning Module Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cloud computing concepts, foundational knowledge of educational modeling languages, basic principles of language learning design, foundational understanding of teaching methodologies for the four language skills (reading/writing/listening/speaking)
context.additional_context: Strengthening language instructional design capabilities in smartphone-based learning environments using cloud resources and educational modeling tools. Focuses on integrating text-, voice-, and video-based language learning materials, with particular emphasis on ensuring accessibility for multicultural learners and designing integrated language skills (integrated skills)

learning_goals: Learners design one cloud-based language learning module using IMS Learning Design standards, submit design documents meeting ≥2 of 3 criteria (alignment of learning objectives-activities-assessment, interaction implementation, technical accessibility), with a special focus on integrated vocabulary/grammar/expression evaluation systems

Structuring metadata for educational resource identification, reuse, and sharing: Systematically classifying language learning content (text/audio/video) by language skills (reading/writing/listening/speaking)
Cultivating the ability to apply mobile-optimized microlearning language content development frameworks: Designing context-aware language use (contextualized language use) content

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
